intro: Aphanamixis cochinchinensis, commonly known as the Vietnamese ironwood, is a deciduous tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rhoipteleaceae and is characterized by its dense, hard wood and evergreen foliage. The plant has compound leaves with alternate arrangement and produces small, inconspicuous flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in forested areas. Due to its slow growth and rarity, it is considered a valuable and endangered species in its native habitat.
